file_content.text: Holographic link = closed // Program = scan + patrol.
Registration = CN-94 // Purpose = Imperial asset identification + coordination.
Identity scan = complete // Processing + uploading.
Is there something you want, droid?
What's this about?
Assessment = complete // Holographic link = open.
Where do you think you're sending that scan?
Uploading to whom?
Master = Imperial command presence // Holographic link = open.
Stupid droid.
Initial request = insufficient to countermand programming // Holographic link = open.
Forgive the unorthodox introductions. Maro Vizhen, head of Special Operations for the Imperial Diplomatic Service.
I need assistance plucking a thorn from the Empire's side. It's a trivial task for a group of your ability, but I want the world to see your power.
I need assistance plucking a thorn from the Empire's side. It should be a trivial task for a Sith, my lord, but I want the world to see your power.
The world already fears me. As should you.
My power is already known.
Be careful what you seek to unleash.
The world trembles at my feet.
Of course. I meant no disrespect.
I need assistance plucking a thorn from the Empire's side. It isn't strictly an Intelligence concern, but I hope you'll hear me out.
We're all servants of the Empire here. What did you have in mind?
Always glad to cooperate.
I need assistance plucking a thorn from the Empire's side. It's a straightforward job, and it should earn a tidy profit.
If the job were simple, you wouldn't need to hire me.
It's never that easy.
Ah, but now I have your attention.
Give me details.
I didn't come to Nar Shaddaa for the Diplomatic Service.
Don't waste my time.
Special Operations. We're not all talk, you know.
I was tasked with gathering allies on Nar Shaddaa. Hutt clans, corporations, gangsters. But one man has resisted our entreaties.
Ukabi is the local leader of the Exchange--a galaxy-spanning criminal organization specializing in high-tech vice. Ukabi and the Exchange refuse to join us.
You want me to convince this "Ukabi" to change his mind?
I can persuade him to join.
We're long past that point.
What does the Empire want from these gangsters?
Why do you need criminals?
Not my concern.
The Exchange spends more money than most governments on spies, slicers and scientists. Anyone they can't buy, they kidnap.
They would've been valuable friends, but Ukabi drugs and tortures my messengers. We need to make an example of him.
Defiance is unacceptable. He should be dealt with.
I tend to agree.
If one crime lord resists the Empire, others will, too.
I tend to agree.
Very astute.
"Make an example of him"? How?
I'm running out of patience.
I want his army decimated, his arms caches looted, his chemical refineries razed to the ground.
I want a show of force so overwhelming that no one on Nar Shaddaa will ever deny the Empire again. If you would grant us this favor.
I want a show of force so overwhelming that no one on Nar Shaddaa will ever deny the Empire again. If you're willing, of course.
You shall witness the might of the Sith and the fall of the Exchange.
Very well.
It may serve my purposes. The Exchange will burn.
Very well.
I normally avoid public spectacles, but I can make an exception.
I can handle it.
I've taken on gangs single-handed before.
I can handle it.
I expect compensation.
The Diplomatic Service will compensate you fully for your time. In addition, the wealth of the Exchange is yours to claim.
The Exchange operates out of the Corellian Sector of the city. Your path of destruction begins there.
When you're through crippling their operations, you can find me at my command post. I'll be watching the chaos from my chambers.
Not today. [Refuse quest.]
Very well. If that is your decision, I won't try to sway you. Farewell.
Program = scan + patrol.
